name: getHttpContents
shortDescription: Returns the source of a web page
description: This method returns the source of a web page as a string. It was implemented to add the possibility of accessing web pages in an SSL-encrypted manner on embedded systems when OpenSSL certificate verification is not working.
signatures: string getHttpContents(string $hostname, int $port, string $path, string $caFile, bool $verifyCertificate)

parameters.name: hostname
parameters.description: The hostname of the web server that you use to get the source

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The port number that the web server listens on

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file to be returned

parameters.name: caFile
parameters.description: The path to the certificate file that is used to check the web server certificate

parameters.name: verifyCertificate
parameters.description: It enables certificate verification. Disable this only for testing purposes.

returnValue: It returns the source of the specified web page as a string and "false" if there are errors.
